186009274.review:
Это был 2009 год, там был 13-ти летний я, у меня был диск(возможно с чёрным флагом, не помню), который я взял у знакомого...
---
 Эх, в то время у меня не было интернета, жил я в деревне. И одно из развлечений, была эта игра. Я начал своё знакомство с серией именно с ярости кейна. 
По сей день, нет РТС, который меня так цеплял. 

Графика в то время(да и сейчас эта мрачная атмосфера, которая придаёт реализма) была шедевр. Звуки - шедевр, взрывы смачные и конечно же (ракета что надо). 

Иногда я просто заходил в сражения, выключал бота и строил базу без ограничений.

Сейчас таких игр уже не делают(. 
(Generals конечно всёровно ванлав с доставками GLA)

185935143.review:
Bonjour à tous, le nombre d'heures que j'ai sur steam n'est pas représentatif du réel nombre d'heures. C&C 3 et Kane Wrath sont des STR d'une qualité incroyable ! Ils dépassent tout les autres dans beaucoup de domaines.
La campagne de KW est un peu moins longue bien que celle de Tiberium Wars, mais elle est plus difficile
La musique est incroyable, les effets sonores, d'ambiance et les voix FR et VO sont vraiment fantastiques !!

Concernant le multi, c'est un jeux qui a été pensé pour du compétitif, il faut allez sur C&C Online (revora) pour faire fonctionner tout les jeux c&c en ligne (Les guerres du Tibérium (TW), La Fureur de Kane (KW) et Alerte Rouge 3 (RA3)
Sur KW spécifiquement, pour jouer en ligne avec les derniers patchs qui corrige 100% des problèmes de base, il faut installer l'application CommandPost, et mettre les maps 1.02+ 
Il y a aussi le patch 4K, entièrement réalisé à la main, celui-ci est une oeuvre d'art, qui met toute les textures et les assets graphiques des cartes et units en 4K, donc même sans écran 4K, la qualité graphique du jeux est infiniment meilleur que le jeux de base

Je pourrais passer des heures à donner des anecdotes sur ce jeux, le mieux si vous voulez commencer le multijoueurs et vous confrontez aux joueurs online, est  de m'ajouter sur Steam pour que je vous montre comment avoir un jeux qui fonctionne sans aucun bug et en multi

Pour les plus techniques d'entre vous, si vous n'arrivez pas à vous connecter au multi de C&C 3/KW/RA3, il faut demander dans votre box le paramètre IPV4, ainsi vous arriverez à vous connecter aux autres joueurs 

N'hésitez pas à me contacter, je suis le spécialiste technique Français de KW, mon Discord : joce2538

185228803.review:
[h1][i]“CABAL is no more, though his memory lives on.”[/i]
~Kane[/h1]

Ah, yes. The expansions. Those sure changed with time. And when it's about [b]C&C[/b], it's even more interesting. I mean, [b]C&C[/b] is a pretty old series. The one that started in times when the expansions were mostly a thing for people who just wanted more of exactly the same. Back in the [b]DOS[/b] times, those were just extra floppies with some more missions on 'em. End of the story. Fine with hardcore fans, pretty boring for everybody else. And since the original [b]C&C[/b] came out at the end of that era, all CDs and sh*t, it kinda caught that old thing too. The original game had mission CD called [b]Covered Operations[/b], [b]Red Alert[/b] had not one, but two of those, and of course, the new missions were pretty good, but still, it was just that. More missions. No new story, no new cutscenes, nothing like that.

It all changed for the series when long-awaited [b]Tiberian Sun[/b] arrived. Its [b]Firestorm[/b] expansion, despite not having those expensive actors from the main game, had solid story with lots of cutscenes. If something, [b]Firestorm[/b] events were at least as important as the [b]Tiberian Sun[/b] itself. And now? Now it's time for us to get back to them. See, [b]Kane's Wrath[/b] is not a sequel to the [b]Tiberium Wars[/b]. Instead, it's a prequel that is supposed to serve as a bridge between [b]Westwood[/b]'s [b]Firestorm[/b] and [b]EA[/b]'s [b]C&C3[/b]. And even though usually I'm not really a fan of prequels, this time? This time it makes a lot of sense. Like, [i]a lot[/i]. The problem with story in [b]C&C3[/b] was that it brought lots of questions. In a way, it didn't make sense at all and felt more like something from an alternative timeline than a proper sequel. [b]Kane's Wrath[/b]? [b]Kane Wrath[/b] is here to fix that.

The beginning of this expansion brings us back to the end of [b]GDI[/b]'s campaign in [b]Firestorm[/b]. [b]Nod[/b] is defeated, [b]CABAL[/b] is destroyed and [b]Kane[/b]'s dead. Is he, though? That's... actually my biggest complaint about the [b]Kane's Wrath[/b] story (aside from the fact that what we've got at its end is [i]another[/i] cliffhanger). While aiming to clarify things to us, the expansion still doesn't say anything about [b]Kane[/b] directly. I know, I know, it's a [b]C&C[/b] thing. Not telling too much, I mean. Keeping things unsaid. But at this point it's starting to feel ridiculous. I mean, was it [i]that[/i] hard to properly explain things for a change? It was 2009! Many people forgot about [b]Firestorm[/b]'s ending long ago, while many others didn't even play it at all. Yet here we are. Having “new” [b]Kane[/b] posing as “old” [b]Kane[/b]. With no explanation whatsoever. Thankfully, aside from that, [b]Kane's Wrath[/b] does surprisingly nice job explaining to us what happened in [b]C&C3[/b]. All of those “Wait, what? Why?” moments are properly explained and if something, the story here is better than what we had in the main game. There's a catch, though.

While the main game's campaign had 38 missions in it (17 missions per faction, plus 4 missions long bonus campaign for [b]Scrin[/b]), this expansion only has 13. And we can only play as [b]Nod[/b]. That's right, for the very first time in history the campaign offers us only one side of the conflict. Like... what? I know, it's called [b]Kane's Wrath[/b], while all factions got new units (some of which are so fat that it makes things to feel a lot like kaijū battle), but come on! [i]Seriously?[/i] Sounds like a joke to me. Thankfully, there's something to make us all feel better about that. And it's time for us to remember another game from the past – [b]C&C Generals[/b]. Remember its challenge mode? The one that was planned for the original game but didn't arrive until the expansion called [b]Zero Hour[/b]? That's exactly what we've got here. At least on [b]Xbox 360[/b], because so-called “[b]Kane's Challenge[/b]” mode is exclusive to consoles (despite [b]C&C3[/b] being a cross-platform game, console version had its differences), while here, on PCs we've got [b]Global Conquest[/b]. Which is... something entirely different. Ever wondered how [b]C&C[/b] will do in the [b]Total War[/b] environment? Global map and sh*t? [b]Global Conquest[/b] is pretty much it.

The global map there is turn-based. We build bases and we create so-called “strike forces”. A movable squads that contain multiple units. If such squad has mobile construction vehicle ([b]MCV[/b]) in it, it can build a new base in its vicinity. If it doesn't, it's only good to attack things. Naturally, strike forces' moves are limited, don't expect them to cross, like, the entire map in one turn. Also, everything in [b]Global Conquest[/b] mode can only do one task per turn. Bases, for example, may upgrade to the next tier to get access to better strike forces, [i]or[/i] (for example) improve their defenses. [b]Tiberium[/b] is there too, of course (every base generate a certain amount of income per turn), which means we should think carefully where to build. [i]Now[/i]. When it's about [b]Total War[/b], there's another part of gameplay – the actual battles. Right? Well, as you can easily guess, those are presented in [b]Global Conquest[/b] mode too and, of course, those are pretty much our usual [b]C&C[/b] thing. In other words, we've got same old [b]C&C3[/b], [i]but[/i] with the global strategy elements now. Which, I think, was a great idea. I mean, series had global map elements since very beginning, since [b]Dune II[/b] times. And while back in the days we were only able to choose where to strike (which determined our next mission), it was only logical for a global map to evolve into something bigger. I mean, this here? It's the future. Is it perfect, though? Well...

The problem with [b]Global Conquest[/b] is that it's... clunky as heck. No, seriously, it feels [i]painfully[/i] cheap. It's way too limited, way too repetitive, it gets old pretty soon, playing every single battle manually may take ages, while auto-resolve feature is full of loopholes and you can easily trick the computer when you learn about how it “thinks”. It's just... It's not [i]fun[/i]. Enough. If you know what I mean. If something, I had more fun simply facing one enemy after another in [b]Kane's Challenge[/b]. Not like [b]Global Conquest[/b] was bad, it was just... more like proof of concept than a real thing. But of course, we'll see it all fixed and improved in the next game, right? [i]Right?[/i] *SIGH* Yes, I'm doing [b]Padmé[/b]'s face, while writing this.

Let's not think about [b]C&C4[/b] for now, though. [b]Kane's Wrath[/b] is... Like I said, in many ways it's disappointing. It tries to do [b]Firestorm[/b] thing with less expensive actors and stuff, but fails to deliver the length. It tries to explain things to us, but fails to achieve that half of a time too. It introduces us to the revolutionary new mode, but fails to provide both quality [i]and[/i] depth. And since the official multiplayer is long dead (again, there's still a way to play this game online thanks to some third-party software)... You know how it is. Not letting us buy separate titles was a weird decision on [b]EA[/b]'s side, but in a way, their [b]Ultimate Collection[/b] does make sense. Things like [b]Kane's Wrath[/b] in their current state are something you buy as a part of [b]$19.88[/b] bundle and then play for nostalgia or history purpose. And let me tell you, history-wise, it's very important for us to remember [b]Kane's Wrath[/b]. Because, while being far from perfection, it marks a point, at which series started to think about the next big step. While playing it smart, [b]EA[/b] managed to save [b]C&C[/b] for some time. The next-gen version of the 1995 game worked for a moment, but time didn't stand still and there was a need for something new. [b]Kane's Wrath[/b] offered us its vision. Did [b]EA[/b] follow it? Well, that's the story for another day.

185223392.review:
Regardless of how you may feel about the changes from Tiberian Sun to the 3rd game, it is undeniable that both Tiberium Wars and this Expansion are very fun games that never let you get tired of playing them!

And the mod community has a lot to offer to these two games as well! From full blown reconstructions like Tiberium Essence, to simpler and more humble mods like custom additional maps. No matter what, you can only expand your fun time with these games! ^_^
(plus, for those still missing the old days, Tiberian Sun and Firestorm are finally available on Steam, so... 8D )

184192711.review:
This was the last good Command and Conquer game ever released. I still like Tiberian Sun over it, but still. This brought back the classic CnC style for one last run.                                                                                                                                 In the name of Kane! The Command & Conquer™ series continues to thrive with Command & Conquer™ 3: Kane’s Wrath.

As the expansion pack to the critically-acclaimed and fan favorite, Command & Conquer 3 Tiberium Wars™, this Real-time Strategy (RTS) game returns to the Tiberium Universe with Kane at the center of an epic new single player campaign spanning 20 years – from the rebirth of the Brotherhood of Nod after the Second Tiberium War through the dramatic events of the Third Tiberium War and beyond.

This story will be told through a new set of high-definition, live action video sequences starring a celebrity cast including Joe Kucan, playing the megalomaniac leader of the Brotherhood of Nod, alongside new talent Natasha Henstridge and Carl Lumbly. With your help, Commander, the Dark Messiah may rise again!

183563108.review:
這是EA當年砸錢動用了好萊塢的資源6個月就做出來的經典3代的資料片
在原有基礎上豐富了遊戲內容並交代了2戰和3代之間和3代結尾部分的劇情
演員、攝影、劇情、音樂、美術、服飾、單位造型無一例外的非常大氣
放到現在都不遜色，國外玩家更製作了4k材質mod，令畫質翻新（不過不支持steam版，因為steam版是脫離本體獨立存在，而那個mod需要識別原版的3代和資料片整合包）
遊戲性也是滿滿，不會為了搞電競弄那些二次元或者同質化的東西
